010package imagingbook.lib.ij;
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.WindowManager;
014import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
015import ij.io.OpenDialog;
016import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
017import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.Comparator;
022import java.util.LinkedList;
023import java.util.List;
024
025
026/**
027 * TODO: Clarify assumed arrangement of 2D arrays!
028 * @author WB
029 *
030 */
031public abstract class IjUtils {
032        
033        /**
034         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
035         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
036         * 
037         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
038         * @return an array of currently open images.
039         */
040        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
041                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
042        }
043        
044
045        /**
046         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
047         * of the images supplied.
048         * 
049         * @param images array of images.
050         * @return array of names.
051         */
052        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
053                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
054                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
055                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
056                }
057                return imageNames;
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
062         * @param title string to show in the dialog
063         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
064         */
065        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
066                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
067                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
068                if (title == null) {
069                        title = "image:";
070                }
071                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
072                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
073                gd.showDialog(); 
074                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
075                        return null;
076                else {
077                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
078                }
079        }
080        
081        
082        /**
083         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
084         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
085         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
086         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
087         * 
088         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
089         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
090         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
091         */
092        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
093                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
094                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
095        if (wList != null) {
096                for (int i : wList) {
097                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
098                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
099                        imgList.add(imp);
100                    }
101                }
102        }
103        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
104        if (sortByTitle) {
105                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
106                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
107                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
108                        }
109                };
110                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
111        }
112                return impArr;
113        }
114        
115
116        /**
117         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
118         *  
119         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
120         * @return path of the selected resource.
121         */
122        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
123                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
124                String dir = od.getDirectory();
125                String name = od.getFileName();
126                if (name == null)
127                        return null;
128                return encodeURL(dir + name);
129        }
130        
131        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
132                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
133                url = url.replace('\\','/');
134                return url;
135        }
136        
137        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
138        
139
140        /**
141         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
142         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
143         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
144         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
145         * 
146         * @param title image title
147         * @param M 2D array
148         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
149         */
150        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
151                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
152                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
153                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
154                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
155                        }
156                }
157                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
158        }
159        
160
161        /**
162         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
163         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
164         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
165         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
166         * 
167         * @param title the image title
168         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
169         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
170         */
171        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
172                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
173                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
174                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
175                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
176                        }
177                }
178                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
179        }
180        
181        /**
182         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
183         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
184         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
185         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
186         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
187         * 
188         * @param ip The affected image
189         */
190        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
191                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
192        }
193        
194        /**
195         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
196         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
197         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
198         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
199         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
200         * 
201         * @param ip The affected image
202         * @param wr Red weight
203         * @param wg Green weight
204         * @param wb Blue weight
205         */
206        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
207                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
208                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
209                }
210        }
211        
212        
213        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
214        
215        /** 
216         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
217         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
218         * @param fp the image
219         * @return the resulting array
220         */
221        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
222                final int width = fp.getWidth();
223                final int height = fp.getHeight();
224                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
225                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
226                int i = 0;
227                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
228                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
229                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
230                                i++;
231                        }
232                }
233                return dPixels;
234        }
235        
236        /**
237         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
238         * from the given 2D array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
239         * 
240         * @param dPixels a 2D {@code double} array
241         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
242         */
243        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] dPixels) {
244                final int width = dPixels.length;
245                final int height = dPixels[0].length;
246                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
247                int i = 0;
248                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
249                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
250                                fPixels[i] = (float) dPixels[u][v];
251                                i++;
252                        }
253                }
254                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
255        }
256
257}
